articles.headline: The Rise and Fall and Rise of Jeanine Pirro of Fox News
articles.snippet: The former prosecutor has found new notoriety — and big ratings — with her ferocious harangues on behalf of an old friend, President Trump.
articles.abstract: The former prosecutor has found new notoriety — and big ratings — with her ferocious harangues on behalf of an old friend, President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: One evening in 1996, as the Yankees clinched their first World Series in 18 years, Donald J. Trump was presiding over a masquerade ball at his sprawling Westchester County estate.

articles.headline: After Tight Race, Netanyahu Appears Poised to Form Israel’s Next Government
articles.snippet: With most of the votes counted, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu looked much likelier than his chief rival, Benny Gantz, to be able to form a governing coalition.
articles.abstract: With most of the votes counted, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu looked much likelier than his chief rival, Benny Gantz, to be able to form a governing coalition.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s conservative prime minister for the past decade, appeared poised to win a fourth consecutive term in office, and a fifth overall, according to preliminary results early on Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Isabel Kershner and David M. Halbfinger

articles.headline: Mick Mulvaney Tries Letting Trump Be Trump
articles.snippet: For the first time since taking office, Mr. Trump has a chief of staff who has made it his job to encourage rather than restrain the president’s conservative instincts.
articles.abstract: For the first time since taking office, Mr. Trump has a chief of staff who has made it his job to encourage rather than restrain the president’s conservative instincts.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump met with his embattled homeland security secretary on Sunday to force her out after months of stormy eruptions over immigration policy, the only other person in the room was Mick Mulvaney, who made no effort to head off the final confrontation and instead helped draft the letter of resignation.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: $7 Million Trump Building Condo Tied to Scandal-Scarred Foreign Leader
articles.snippet: A company owned by the daughter of the Republic of Congo’s president paid $7 million for an apartment in a Trump building overlooking Central Park, a nonprofit group found.
articles.abstract: A company owned by the daughter of the Republic of Congo’s president paid $7 million for an apartment in a Trump building overlooking Central Park, a nonprofit group found.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Trump International Hotel and Tower in Manhattan, near the southwest corner of Central Park, is a 44-story building with a mix of luxury condominiums and hotel suites that go for more than $2,500 a night.

articles.headline: Medicare for All and Beyond, Sanders Uses the Senate as His Launching Pad
articles.snippet: Senator Bernie Sanders reintroduced his Medicare for All Act on Wednesday in a choreographed event charged with the unmistakable presidential politics of 2020.
articles.abstract: Senator Bernie Sanders reintroduced his Medicare for All Act on Wednesday in a choreographed event charged with the unmistakable presidential politics of 2020.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Bernie Sanders stepped to the lectern on Wednesday, red-faced and rumpled as ever, with a placard screaming “Medicare for All,” and likened his quest for a government-run universal health plan to earlier movements for women’s rights, civil rights, workers’ rights and gay rights.

articles.headline: It’s Netanyahu’s Israel Now
articles.snippet: In re-electing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Israelis endorsed a politician who offered himself as the embodiment of stability and military and economic security.
articles.abstract: In re-electing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Israelis endorsed a politician who offered himself as the embodiment of stability and military and economic security.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Benjamin Netanyahu’s apparent re-election as prime minister of Israel attests to a starkly conservative vision of the Jewish state and its people about where they are and where they are headed.
